Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Father George Anastasiou, The Community of Transfiguration of Christ Greek Orthodox Church, 3805 98th Street, Corona, New York 11368.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Ferreras.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Father George Anastasiou, the Community of Transfiguration of Christ Greek Orthodox Church, 3805 98th Street, Corona, N.Y. 11368.



Council Member Feereras moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend local law number 115 for the year 2005, relating to child fatalities, in relation to a child fatality review advisory team.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Child fatality review advisory team.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, Lauren’s Law, S.7103/A.10039, legislation that would require mandatory registration or declination of registration in the organ donor registry.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Require mandatory registration or declination of registration in the organ donor registry. (S.7103/A.10039)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign legislation that would amend the Penal Law to create the crime of staging a motor vehicle accident.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Create the crime of staging a motor vehicle accident.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to fines for failures to comply with commercial waste disposal policies.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Fines for failures to comply with commercial waste disposal policies.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Department of Education to convene a task force to review the outreach practices and graduate outcomes at institutions with gainful employment programs in New York State.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Dept of Education to convene a task force to review the outreach practices and graduate outcomes at institutions with gainful employment programs in NYS.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York and local law number 63 for the year 2005, relating to tracking and reporting by the department of health and mental hygiene, in relation to requiring such department to track and report deaths of homeless persons in the city of New York.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of health and mental hygiene to track and report deaths of homeless persons in the NYC.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the creation of guidelines for traffic calming devices.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Creation of guidelines for traffic calming devices.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring fencing on pedestrian passageways elevated over vehicular or pedestrian right of ways.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Requiring fencing on pedestrian passageways elevated over vehicular or pedestrian right of ways.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to pass and the President to sign H.R.2966/S.1176, the American Horse Slaughter Prevention Act of 2011.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: American Horse Slaughter Prevention Act of 2011. (H.R.2966/S.1176)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to disclosing the energy and water efficiency in dwelling units, co-ops and condominiums in buildings under fifty thousand square feet.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Disclosing the energy and water efficiency in dwelling units, co-ops and condominiums in buildings under fifty thousand square feet.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the reporting of deficiencies in Department of Homeless Services adult and family shelters, and to repeal subdivision e of section 21-312.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Reporting of deficiencies in Department of Homeless Services adult and family shelters, and to repeal subdivision e of section 21-312.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to improving compliance with the City’s Pro-Voter Law.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Re-referred to Committee by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Improving compliance with the City’s Pro-Voter Law.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to diversifying the membership of the conflicts of interest board.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Diversifying the membership of the conflicts of interest board.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to the expansion of the Franchise and Concession Review Committee.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Expansion of the Franchise and Concession Review Committee.

Items.Title:
By Council Member James:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226 (g) or Section 20-225(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed/enclosed sidewalk café located at 268 Kingston Avenue, Borough of Brooklyn, Committee Board no.8, Application 20125051 TCK shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk café, 268 Kingston Ave, Brooklyn (20125051 TCK)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Levin:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226 (g) or Section 20-225(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed/enclosed sidewalk café located at 68 Bergen Street, Borough of Brooklyn, Committee Board no.2, Application 20125008 TCK shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk café, 68 Bergen St, Brooklyn (20125008 TCK)
